trans-unit.source: You can use the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function to analyze the <term>execution duration</term> of the useful SQL statements in the <filepath>derby.log</filepath> file or a log file that you specify.

seg-source.mrk: You can use the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function to analyze the <term>execution duration</term> of the useful SQL statements in the <filepath>derby.log</filepath> file or a log file that you specify.

target.mrk: You can use the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function to analyze the <term>execution duration</term> of the useful SQL statements in the <filepath>derby.log</filepath> file or a log file that you specify.

trans-unit.source: You can also use this diagnostic table function to get an indication of where the bottlenecks are in the JDBC code for an application.

seg-source.mrk: You can also use this diagnostic table function to get an indication of where the bottlenecks are in the JDBC code for an application.

target.mrk: You can also use this diagnostic table function to get an indication of where the bottlenecks are in the JDBC code for an application.

trans-unit.source: For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can access this diagnostic table function.

seg-source.mrk: For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can access this diagnostic table function.

target.mrk: For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can access this diagnostic table function.

trans-unit.source: To access the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function, you must use the SQL table function syntax.

seg-source.mrk: To access the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function, you must use the SQL table function syntax.

target.mrk: To access the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function, you must use the SQL table function syntax.

trans-unit.source: where T1 is a user-specified table name that is any valid identifier.

seg-source.mrk: where T1 is a user-specified table name that is any valid identifier.

target.mrk: where T1 is a user-specified table name that is any valid identifier.

trans-unit.source: For each transaction ID, a row is not returned for the last statement with that transaction ID. Transaction IDs change within a connection after a commit or rollback, if the transaction that just ended modified data.

seg-source.mrk: For each transaction ID, a row is not returned for the last statement with that transaction ID.
Transaction IDs change within a connection after a commit or rollback, if the transaction that just ended modified data.

target.mrk: For each transaction ID, a row is not returned for the last statement with that transaction ID.
Transaction IDs change within a connection after a commit or rollback, if the transaction that just ended modified data.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a log file name as an optional argument to the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function. When you specify a log file name, the file name must be an expression whose data type maps to a Java string.

seg-source.mrk: You can specify a log file name as an optional argument to the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function.
When you specify a log file name, the file name must be an expression whose data type maps to a Java string.

target.mrk: You can specify a log file name as an optional argument to the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function.
When you specify a log file name, the file name must be an expression whose data type maps to a Java string.

trans-unit.source: By default <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> log files contain only boot, shutdown, and error messages. See the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper26985.dita#rrefproper26985">derby.stream.error.logSeverityLevel</xref></codeph> property and the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper43517.dita#rrefproper43517">derby.language.logStatementText</xref></codeph> property for instructions on how to print more information to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> log files. You can then query that information by using the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function.

seg-source.mrk: By default <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> log files contain only boot, shutdown, and error messages.

See the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper26985.dita#rrefproper26985">derby.stream.error.logSeverityLevel</xref></codeph> property and the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper43517.dita#rrefproper43517">derby.language.logStatementText</xref></codeph> property for instructions on how to print more information to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> log files.
You can then query that information by using the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function.

target.mrk: By default <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> log files contain only boot, shutdown, and error messages.

See the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper26985.dita#rrefproper26985">derby.stream.error.logSeverityLevel</xref></codeph> property and the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper43517.dita#rrefproper43517">derby.language.logStatementText</xref></codeph> property for instructions on how to print more information to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> log files.
You can then query that information by using the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION diagnostic table function.

trans-unit.source: For the columns returned by the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION table function, this table provides its data type, its length in bytes, whether it is nullable, and a description of its contents.

seg-source.mrk: For the columns returned by the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION table function, this table provides its data type, its length in bytes, whether it is nullable, and a description of its contents.

target.mrk: For the columns returned by the SYSCS_DIAG.STATEMENT_DURATION table function, this table provides its data type, its length in bytes, whether it is nullable, and a description of its contents.

trans-unit.source: The text of the statement or commit or rollback.

seg-source.mrk: The text of the statement or commit or rollback.

target.mrk: The text of the statement or commit or rollback.

trans-unit.source: The duration, in milliseconds, of the statement.
